6bd21495-6daf-4a6d-8982-982d4a77837f.description: Earners of this badge have an understanding of the process that drives UX thinking and fosters skills for collaboration and problem-solving. Students understand the user experience process of Human-Centered Design for designing and solving business problems. Students understand the process that drives UX thinking and fosters skills for collaboration and problem-solving.
6bd21495-6daf-4a6d-8982-982d4a77837f.name: User Experience - Human-Centered Design

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: This course introduces students to the user experience process of Human-Centered Design for designing and solving business problems.

Students conduct goal definition, user research, synthesis, ideation, create lo to high fidelity prototypes of an app, website or service and provide insight to their process for conducting these exercises. Students work individually and in groups of 3 or more.
Participate in the Design Challenge group project (continued in Visual Design).
Demonstrate the ability to apply human-centered design methods to solve a problem collaboratively and use storytelling to present findings.

0f5bf30f-5dc1-4093-8844-758120a9c2b3.description: Earners of this badge have developed the skills needed to visualize and design apps for all platforms. The process includes planning, design thinking, visual design, and interaction design. Emphasis will be placed on learning the UX process, design principles, aesthetics, web and mobile design concepts, color, typography, visual communication, design elements and patterns, and design process from concept to completion.
0f5bf30f-5dc1-4093-8844-758120a9c2b3.name: User Experience - Visual Design

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: This course immerses students in the practice of UX and Visual Design for Digital Interfaces.

Students ideate, sketch, wireframe, create lo fidelity comps and high fidelity prototypes of an app or website and resolve all design related issues including layout, color and type. Students work individually and in pairs and groups of 3.
Participate in the Design Challenge group project (started in Human-Centered Design).
Demonstrate the ability to bring a concept to life through Art Direction, UX, Visual Design and Prototyping.

d504bbda-e3c4-4c2c-9437-aea0868579cb.description: Earners of this badge have developed the skills needed to create digital interfaces that respect Heuristics, Design Thinking, Gestalt, and Accessibility and Interaction Design principles. They can conduct research with users, map qualitative data, gain insights to generate inspiration, and design sketched and digital clickable prototypes. Earners will have completed the following courses: Human-Centered Design and Visual Design.
d504bbda-e3c4-4c2c-9437-aea0868579cb.name: User Experience (UX) Microcredential

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Human-Centered Design course at Kingsborough Community College.
Successful completion of the Visual Design course at Kingsborough Community College.

98853722-162b-404b-9ee1-59d9c0573192.description: Earners of this badge understand effective business-level UX communication and nuances of how UX engages with the business side.
98853722-162b-404b-9ee1-59d9c0573192.name: User Experience - Entrepreneurship

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: In this course, students learn a series of tangible and intangible skills via storytelling to establish and illustrate what attitudes and posture will help them be successful and then towards tangible applicable skills to apply in the UX industry and the business world in general.
Individually, students will benchmark usability of a website using the System Usability Scale (SUS).
As a group, students will respond to a Request for Proposal (RFP) and present to a panel.

1cc83039-95e7-444d-a6be-10ac3a18863f.description: Originally developed by the Education Design Lab, the 21st Century Skill of Intercultural fluency includes the capacity to operate and communicate in different cultural contexts. Earners of this badge are fluent interculturally exhibit four core sub-competencies. They recognize and challenge their own cultural biases; show curiosity; demonstrate self-awareness; and incorporate diverse perspectives.
1cc83039-95e7-444d-a6be-10ac3a18863f.name: User Experience - Intercultural Fluency

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in the "Heuristics and UX Laws" course. This course discusses what Visual Design is and its impact on the final UI. Presenting the Laws of UX applied to Visual Design, and the different layouts existing in the web industry. Students receive an introduction to Heuristics.
Attend and participate in the "Colors, Contrast Ratio, and Accessibility" course. This class discusses how to create a color palette that respects the minimum contrast ratio and that is accessible.

During the mid-stage of their project, students have taken into consideration feedback from Peer Reviewers, and have gained insights and utilized the information to improve on their deliverables. Students have showcased their ability to work as a team member, demonstrated self-awareness and are able to provide positive criticism.

204c9dcc-79d0-48b4-9863-d3de1fca0901.description: Earners of this badge understand the process of development of HTML/CSS functional prototypes in order to better communicate with a team of Front-end developers, and are able to perform usability testing at a higher level. The concentration is on HTML/CSS, Interaction Design, and UX Design theories applied to an interactive and responsive interface, along with an introduction to jQuery.
204c9dcc-79d0-48b4-9863-d3de1fca0901.name: User Experience - Coding for Designers

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: This course addresses gaps in the field pertaining to handoffs and collaboration with Development teams by letting students experiment with Front-End Development firsthand. Students gain a greater empathy and communication for both the Development team and the users.
Students create coded prototypes with an interactive and responsive interface.
Demonstrate the ability to bring a concept to life through Front-End Development.

0c5d752c-b61a-4025-b071-b402a8c16910.description: Earners of this badge have developed the skills needed to create digital interfaces that respect Heuristics, Design Thinking, Gestalt, and Accessibility and Interaction Design principles. They can conduct research with users, map qualitative data, gain insights to generate inspiration, and design sketched and digital clickable prototypes. Earners will have completed the following courses: Human-Centered Design, Visual Design, Coding for Designers, and UX Entrepreneurship.
0c5d752c-b61a-4025-b071-b402a8c16910.name: DesignWorks - User Experience Design

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Human-Centered Design course at Kingsborough Community College.
Successful completion of the Visual Design course at Kingsborough Community College.
Successful completion of the Coding for Designers course at Kingsborough Community College.
Successful completion of the UX Entrepreneurship course at Kingsborough Community College.

c28e4f37-407e-41bd-8178-ed63011cce45.description: Earners of this badge will gain an understanding of the facilities and property management professions, including aspects of building and construction management, customer service techniques, real estate administration, and crisis management.
c28e4f37-407e-41bd-8178-ed63011cce45.name: Facilities Management Microcredential

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Earner attends and passes this 100-hour training which includes modules in Facilities Management Foundations; Property Management Operations; Workplace Services; Building Systems & Facilities Operations; Real Estate & Space Planning; Customer Service & Relationship Management; Construction & Project Management; Financial Management & Reporting; Environmental Social Governance; Health, Safety & GOVT Regulations; and Business Continuity & Emergency Planning.

86fa6b3e-cf35-4ad2-914b-e3159410851d.description: Earners of this badge are clinical support staff members who provide practice-level care coordination and patient engagement services to the patient population.
86fa6b3e-cf35-4ad2-914b-e3159410851d.name: Health Coach

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Patient Engagement Techniques in Community Health: students learn and practice techniques in self-management support and motivational interviewing strategies to facilitate behavior change in patients with chronic conditions. Students develop an understanding of chronic disease management, wellness and disease prevention, and the basic health coaching skills. At course completion, students know how to educate, engage and support individual patients to improve the patient's health outcomes.

Concepts of Wellness: this fundamental course covers a broad spectrum of health-related topics to make students aware of the causes of mental and physical illnesses and their prevention, and demonstrates how lifestyle, perceptions, and decisions affect health.

189bb310-c0ea-4d67-abb2-48b0c39bc951.description: Earners of this badge will have demonstrated skills, techniques, and best practices for providing excellent customer service. Students develop customer service competencies to increase efficiency, for professional careers in customer service.
189bb310-c0ea-4d67-abb2-48b0c39bc951.name: Customer Service Microcredential

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Students gain a working knowledge of effective communication and develop a keen understanding of interactions through verbal and written communication that drives customer success.

Students will increase competency in managing customer relations through developing skills in conflict resolution and empathy building, through various applications that effectively improve customer relations and interactions.

377b8a32-b4ec-4cc3-8856-718f756825aa.description: In accordance with the competencies put forth by the National Board of Health and Wellness Coaches (NBHWC), the 21st Century Skill of Collaboration includes the capacity to work with clients and patients to enable behaviors that can improve health outcomes . Earners of this badge exhibit four sub-competencies: strengthening relationships, listening actively, incorporating diverse perspectives, and focusing on solutions.
377b8a32-b4ec-4cc3-8856-718f756825aa.name: Health Coach - Collaboration

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in the "Health Coaching" course. This course discusses the basics of health coaching, using effective communication skills to help clients and patients enhance health outcomes, and referring clients and patients to appropriate resources to support their behavior changes. Students receive an Introduction to Health Coaching.

f8661861-86ff-429e-85eb-1817b1da111b.description: In accordance with the competencies put forth by the National Board of Health and Wellness Coaches (NBHWC), the 21st Century Skill of Empathy includes the capacity to communicate with clients and patients in ways that can enhance self-motivation and self-awareness . Earners of this badge exhibit four sub-competencies: listening actively, providing validation, identifying others’ needs and values, and incorporating diverse perspectives.
f8661861-86ff-429e-85eb-1817b1da111b.name: Health Coach - Empathy

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in the "Health Coaching" course. This course discusses the basics of health coaching, using effective communication skills to help clients and patients enhance health outcomes, and referring clients and patients to appropriate resources to support their behavior changes. Students receive an Introduction to Health Coaching.

f5d5a1ce-f5d2-4291-a97a-547aee4dd554.description: Originally developed by the Education Design Lab, the 21st Century Skill of Critical Thinking includes the capacity to reason logically and rigorously. Effective critical thinkers exhibit four core sub-competencies: gather and assess relevant information; identify patterns; question assumptions; and draw well-reasoned conclusions.
f5d5a1ce-f5d2-4291-a97a-547aee4dd554.name: User Experience - Critical Thinking

issuer.summary: issued by Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

entity.name: Division of Workforce Development and Continuing Education at Kingsborough Community College, CUNY

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in the "Heuristics and UX Laws" course. This course discusses what Visual Design is and its impact on the final UI. Presenting the Laws of UX applied to Visual Design, and the different layouts existing in the web industry. Students receive an introduction to Heuristics.
Demonstrate ability to improve the problem-solving process by resisting easy answers and probing more deeply into the data in order to reduce implicit bias.
Showcase ability to using logic and reason to evaluate arguments, form judgments, and make recommendations on a project.
